tagKeys.documentation: A list of tag keys to remove from the Amazon Q Business application or data source. If a tag key does not exist on the resource, it is ignored.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application.

attachmentsConfiguration.documentation: An option to allow end users to upload files directly during chat.

description.documentation: A description for the Amazon Q Business application.

displayName.documentation: A name for the Amazon Q Business application.

roleArn.documentation: An Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that gives Amazon Q Business permission to access Amazon CloudWatch logs and metrics.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the application for which the chat controls are configured.

blockedPhrasesConfigurationUpdate.documentation: The phrases blocked from chat by your chat control configuration.

clientToken.documentation: A token that you provide to identify the request to update a Amazon Q Business application chat configuration.

responseScope.documentation: The response scope configured for your application. This determines whether your application uses its retrieval augmented generation (RAG) system to generate answers only from your enterprise data, or also uses the large language models (LLM) knowledge to respons to end user questions in chat.

topicConfigurationsToCreateOrUpdate.documentation: The configured topic specific chat controls you want to update.

topicConfigurationsToDelete.documentation: The configured topic specific chat controls you want to delete.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application the data source is attached to.

dataSourceId.documentation: The identifier of the data source connector.

description.documentation: The description of the data source connector.

displayName.documentation: A name of the data source connector.

indexId.documentation: The identifier of the index attached to the data source connector.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role with permission to access the data source and required resources.

syncSchedule.documentation: The chosen update frequency for your data source.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application connected to the index.

capacityConfiguration.documentation: The storage capacity units you want to provision for your Amazon Q Business index. You can add and remove capacity to fit your usage needs.

description.documentation: The description of the Amazon Q Business index.

displayName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Q Business index.

documentAttributeConfigurations.documentation: Configuration information for document metadata or fields. Document metadata are fields or attributes associated with your documents. For example, the company department name associated with each document. For more information, see Understanding document attributes.

indexId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business index.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the application the plugin is attached to.

authConfiguration.documentation: The authentication configuration the plugin is using.

displayName.documentation: The name of the plugin.

serverUrl.documentation: The source URL used for plugin configuration.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of your Amazon Q Business application.

displayName.documentation: The name of your retriever.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role with permission to access the retriever and required resources.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the application the user is attached to.

userAliasesToDelete.documentation: The user aliases attached to the user id that are to be deleted.

userAliasesToUpdate.documentation: The user aliases attached to the user id that are to be updated.

userId.documentation: The email id attached to the user.

userAliasesAdded.documentation: The user aliases that have been to be added to a user id.

userAliasesDeleted.documentation: The user aliases that have been deleted from a user id.

userAliasesUpdated.documentation: The user aliases attached to a user id that have been updated.

applicationId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application attached to the web experience.

authenticationConfiguration.documentation: The authentication configuration of the Amazon Q Business web experience.

samplePromptsControlMode.documentation: Determines whether sample prompts are enabled in the web experience for an end user.

subtitle.documentation: The subtitle of the Amazon Q Business web experience.

title.documentation: The title of the Amazon Q Business web experience.

webExperienceId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business web experience.

welcomeMessage.documentation: A customized welcome message for an end user in an Amazon Q Business web experience.

dataSourceId.documentation: The identifier of the data source that the user aliases are associated with.

indexId.documentation: The identifier of the index that the user aliases are associated with.

userId.documentation: The identifier of the user id associated with the user aliases.

UserAlias.documentation: Aliases attached to a user id within an Amazon Q Business application.

userGroups.documentation: The user groups associated with a topic control rule.

userIds.documentation: The user ids associated with a topic control rule.

UsersAndGroups.documentation: Provides information about users and groups associated with a topic control rule.

ValidationException.documentation: The input doesn't meet the constraints set by the Amazon Q Business service. Provide the correct input and try again.

name.documentation: The field name where the invalid entry was detected.

ValidationExceptionField.documentation: The input failed to meet the constraints specified by Amazon Q Business in a specified field.

createdAt.documentation: The Unix timestamp when the Amazon Q Business application was last updated.

defaultEndpoint.documentation: The endpoint URLs for your Amazon Q Business web experience. The URLs are unique and fully hosted by Amazon Web Services.

status.documentation: The status of your Amazon Q Business web experience.

updatedAt.documentation: The Unix timestamp when your Amazon Q Business web experience was updated.

webExperienceId.documentation: The identifier of your Amazon Q Business web experience.

WebExperience.documentation: Provides information for an Amazon Q Business web experience.

WebExperienceAuthConfiguration.documentation: Provides the authorization configuration information needed to deploy a Amazon Q Business web experience to end users.

documentation:
Amazon Q is in preview release and is subject to change.

This is the Amazon Q Business API Reference. Amazon Q Business is a fully managed, generative-AI powered enterprise chat assistant that you can deploy within your organization. Amazon Q Business enhances employee productivity by supporting key tasks such as question-answering, knowledge discovery, writing email messages, summarizing text, drafting document outlines, and brainstorming ideas. Users ask questions of Amazon Q Business and get answers that are presented in a conversational manner. For an introduction to the service, see the Amazon Q Business User Guide .

For an overview of the Amazon Q Business APIs, see Overview of Amazon Q Business API operations.

For information about the IAM access control permissions you need to use this API, see IAM roles for Amazon Q Business in the Amazon Q Business User Guide.

You can use the following AWS SDKs to access Amazon Q Business APIs:

  • AWS SDK for C++

  • AWS SDK for Go

  • AWS SDK for Java

  • AWS SDK for JavaScript

  • AWS SDK for .NET

  • AWS SDK for Python (Boto3)

  • AWS SDK for Ruby

The following resources provide additional information about using the Amazon Q Business API:

  • Setting up for Amazon Q Business

  • Amazon Q Business CLI Reference

  • Amazon Web Services General Reference
